name: Hilton Garden Inn New York - Chelsea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at HGIC for only one night as we were in town for a wedding. Although our room wasn't quite ready an hour after scheduled check in time we were upgraded to a room with a king size bed right away when we indicatedwe had to be at a wedding in about an hour!
reviews.title: great accomodations , ideal location, good value

reviews.text: The room was a nice surprise , decent size, comfy bed, nice flat screen tv.
reviews.title: Best choice in Manhattan

reviews.text: Breakfast was a real good value, with plenty of great choices. We will return when the need arises.
reviews.title: Nice place for the money and location

reviews.text: I have now spent 210 nights at this hotel with many more in my future. This hotel has the amenities to satisfy any traveler with well equiped rooms, easy access to public transportation, and an easy hop to Times Square.
reviews.title: Will definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a week there in late March and was pleasantly surprised. I've stayed at multiple places in Manhattan due to business and I foudn the rooms a little larger and the people a little nicer than most. I will say here the next time.
reviews.title: Bed Bug Free!!!

reviews.text: I love this hotel, with one draw back... no valet parking. The location is awesome, there is so much to do in the area, nightclubs, shopping etc.
reviews.title: Great location and service!

reviews.text: We had an excellent time at this hotel The staff were all very friendly & helpful. Room service did a good job. The room was clean & stylish & we especially appreciated being put on the 22nd floor with a view for our week long stay. Being a small & tall hotel meant there were not many rooms on our floor & hence it was fairly quiet. We didn't eat at the restaurant as we were cheap & so if we wanted it, we had a cooked breakfast for $5 around the corner on 6th at FoodParc. Very central location & was ideal for us to go everywhere using the subway & our feet!
reviews.title: Great location, great room, great service!

reviews.text: We stayed here with our two young children (ages 5 & 6). The rooms were clean and a pretty good size by New York standards. The location is great - within walking distance to the Empire State Building, and with a subway stop half a block away. The staff was very friendly to all of us, including the kids. We will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: great hotel, good location

reviews.text: If you think you've booked a certain type of room, like two double beds in a non-smoking room, and you've called the hotel and reservations twice to confirm your reservation and told that you will indeed have the room that you booked, then think again at this hotel. We checked in tonight, and were sent to the 24th floor, a smoking floor. The rudest front desk clerk that I have ever encountered - and I've traveled extensively - told me that the hotel was sold out, she didn't care that I had allergies, the room that was confirmed by the hotel in my reservation was not available, and hung up the phone. I called HIlton corporate customer service, who in turn called the same person at the hotel, and she was rude to her own corporate office. The only other hotel that I've had similar types of problems in New York with not getting the room that I booked was the Millennium Hilton, so I canceled my Hilton accommodations for my next trip. There are many wonderful hotels in New York that provide good customer service with quality rooms. We checked out, walked across the street to the Fairfield Inn and Suites, and Daniel at the front desk could not have been nicer or more accommodating.
reviews.title: The rudest front desk service I've ever experienced

reviews.text: My wife and I spent two great days in this comfortable, no-nonsense hotel. It was our second visit to the HGI Chelsea within 5 months... this time to celebrate my mom's 90th birthday. When we got out of the taxi the bellman said "welcome back!" He recognized my wife and me from our earlier visit. This is just one small indication of what a good job this hotel does of hiring staff. Everyone in the hotel is accommodating, from the front desk to the wait staff in the breakfast room which serves perfectly cooked-to-order omlettes and eggs. The rooms are clean and modern with very comfortable beds. They are a bit tight on space - not unusual in NYC. The location of the hotel is excellent, just a short walk to either the subway or PATH train. There are only a couple of quibbles: While 28th St. has a number of charming plant and floral shops, there are no interesting restaurants within the immediately vicinity. Secondly, the lobby and public spaces in the hotel (with the exception of the sun-lit breakfast room) are on the small side. Still, the place is well run, the rates are fare for NYC, the rooms and bathrooms are modern and the staff cares. What more do you want from a Hilton Garden Inn?
reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations

reviews.text: We stayed at the HGI Chelsea the first weekend in April. Our list of activities took us to the Upper East Side, Soho, Brooklyn, theater district and to Chelsea with its surrounding neighborhoods. Every stop was easy to get to from our main base at the HGI. The breakfast was a perfect way for us to fuel up for our days of walking and exploring. We slept well in the comfortable beds and there was minimal outside noise. 3 women with suitcases were able to navigate in the room without any issues. It was larger compared to other places we have stayed at in Manhattan such as the Hampton Inn on Chelsea and the Hampton Inn in Soho. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location for All of our Explorations

reviews.text: The concierge told us that taking the shuttle to The World Trade Center would be the same price as a taxi...it wasn't. In fact we took 3 taxis to equal the cost of the 23 dollar shuttle ride. Not happy! Otherwise, the hotel was decent. Location was good, price was reasonable. We enjoyed our stay overall.
reviews.title: Don't take the hotel bus!

reviews.text: While my preferred property in Manhattan is the HGI on 8th (just due to the fact that I am a huge theater fan), I really like this property and will stay here if I am attending an event at MSG or if the rate is substantially less than the HGI on 8th.
reviews.title: Great staff!!!!

reviews.text: The staff here is great. I hadn't stayed at this property in well over a year, and my plans for thanksgiving day weekend fell through a week before so I decided to go to NYC the friday to Sunday after and this property was reasonably priced for that weekend and I wanted to go shopping and it is only a couple blocks from Macys. Even though it had been well over a year since I had last stayed there (maybe even over 2 years), the front desk clerk remembered I had stayed there before and welcomened me back and said it was good to see me again. I have stayed there since and the staff remembers me.
reviews.title: Best hotel in NY

reviews.text: It is near the 1 subway line and a short walk to the 8th street subway and lots of places to eat. Very convenient to Madison Square Garden if you are attending an event there and near Macys and Herald Square shopping. When I go to NYC I spend my time in Chelsea or the theater district or the west village (both are very easy to get to on the 1 line or if you are up for the walk, it is doable walking as well). I also like how close it is to penn station if I am using EWR as the airport since you can walk a few blocks to Penn and grab the train to EWR. Much easier than grabbing the bus from manhattan.
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly service!

reviews.text: I loved the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel. Great rooms, location and service.

reviews.title: Refreshingly friendly staff

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

aka: Hilton Garden Inn New York - Chelsea Hotel New York City
description: Delight in Hilton Garden Inn New York/Chelsea - a modern Madison Square Garden hotel. Perfectly located in the city's Flower and very chic Chelsea district, the hotel is in the heart of it all. Just south of Times Square and convenient to Penn Station, Grand Central Station and all subway lines, this charming Chelsea hotel is central to the wonders of the city. Less than 0.5 miles to Jacob Javits Center Four blocks to Macy's Seven different subway lines within a short walking distance Three blocks to Madison Square Garden. Connect in Business at this Madison Square Garden Hotel. Corporate travelers enjoy an easy walk to many businesses and area corporations: Jacob Javits Convention Center, Fashion Institute of Technology, Flat Iron Building, Macy’s, Fisher Price, Cisco Systems.
